publicwhip.spmotion: S2M-3867 Broadcasting the Bard (lodged on 24 January 2006) Michael Matheson*

S2M-3867 Alasdair Morgan: Broadcasting the Bardâ€”That the Parliament notes with concern the fact that BBC Scotland has only two programmes focusing on the work of Robert Burns planned across its television and radio output for Burns Night, one on Radio Scotland and the other on BBC1, while Radio 3 has a single late-night offering from the Celtic Connections Festival and Scottish, Grampian and Border TV have no programmes planned at all; considers this to be a gross under-representation of the undisputable talent and enduring popularity of Burns, and calls on Scottish broadcasters to devote greater efforts to producing appropriate programmes for Burns Night next year. Supported by: Michael Matheson
S2M-3867 Broadcasting the Bard (lodged on 24 January 2006) Rob Gibson*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-3867 Broadcasting the Bard (lodged on 24 January 2006) Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-3867 Broadcasting the Bard (lodged on 24 January 2006) Dennis Canavan*, Donald Gorrie*, John Swinburne*
S2M-3867 Broadcasting the Bard (lodged on 24 January 2006) Linda Fabiani*
